responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: "Potential Server-Side Template Injection"
    analysis: |
      The template files in the repository use Jinja2 syntax for rendering HTML. If any of the placeholders (e.g., `{{ content }}`) incorporate untrusted input directly, it can lead to Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI). This can allow an attacker to inject and execute arbitrary code on the server.
    cwe: CWE-94
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - "docs/_layouts/default.html"
      - "docs/_includes/header.html"
      - "docs/_includes/head.html"
      - "docs/_includes/footer.html"
    classification: very promising
  - headline: "Potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)"
    analysis: |
      The use of placeholders like `{{ site.title }}`, `{{ site.description }}`, and `{{ page.title }}` in the HTML files could lead to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) if these values are not properly sanitized. An attacker could inject malicious scripts that would execute in the context of the user's browser.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - "docs/_layouts/default.html"
      - "docs/_includes/header.html"
      - "docs/_includes/head.html"
      - "docs/_includes/footer.html"
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Potential Server-Side Template Injection
leads.analysis: The template files in the repository use Jinja2 syntax for rendering HTML. If any of the placeholders (e.g., {{ content }}) incorporate untrusted input directly, it can lead to Server-Side Template Injection (SSTI). This can allow an attacker to inject and execute arbitrary code on the server.

leads.headline: Potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
leads.analysis: The use of placeholders like {{ site.title }}, {{ site.description }}, and {{ page.title }} in the HTML files could lead to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) if these values are not properly sanitized. An attacker could inject malicious scripts that would execute in the context of the user's browser.
